pullrequest.title: All pose messages are sent out in a single message every iteration

content.raw:
I'm seeing a weird behavior with the drcsim standpipe. It can be seen most simply with the drcsim worldfile [fire_hose.world](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim/src/cd8bcc3df9645e7d058f7ce958d5a1e14bec0210/worlds/fire_hose.world?at=default) (ignore the fact that the default gravity in this world is pointing up). When I start gazebo unpaused, the standpipe, which is fixed to the world, renders at a weird angle and position. Using the move or rotate tool causes it to snap back to its correct position. It just seems to be initially displayed with the wrong pose? When starting gazebo paused, it is rendered correctly.

[Here's a video of the incorrect behavior](https://vimeo.com/55494541).
